title: The abbot /
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: " Tie a stone round his neck," said Seyton,  ** and when the sun is down, have him to the Loch of Cleish ; heave him in, and let him alone for finding out the bottom."

title: Memoirs of the life of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Lockhart, J. G.
snippet: They usually contrived to meet on a Friday  ; spent the Saturday in a ride to some scene of historical interest within an easy distance ; enjoyed a quiet Sunday at home — * duly attending divine worship at the Kirk of Cleish (not Cleishbotham) " — gave Monday morning to another Antiquarian excursion, and returned to Edinburgh in time for the Courts of Tuesday.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: [The Willie Michie of this epigram was, it is said, schoolmaster of the parish of Cleish, in Fifeshirc ; he met Burns during his first visit to Edinburgh.]

title: The complete works of Robert Burns: containing his poems, songs, and correspondence.
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: [The Willie Michie of this epigram was, it is said, schoolmaster of the parish of Cleish, in Fifeshire : he met Burns during his first visit to Edinburgh.]
